text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the lobby and leaves for work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs to his apartment on the 10th floor.
However, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.

Why does he do this? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out why this man takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor on rainy days.
Let me break this down step by step.
First, let me understand the normal routine.
Every morning, he lives on the 10th floor, takes the elevator down to the lobby (which is the 1st floor), and leaves for work.
In the evening, when he returns, he takes the elevator up to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs from there to his 10th-floor apartment.
Wait, so on regular days, he doesn't take the elevator all the way home.
He goes to the 7th floor and walks up.
But on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.

Hmm, why would that be?

Maybe it's about the weather.
Rain can make walking difficult, especially if he's walking up stairs after taking the elevator.
If it's raining, the stairs might be slippery, or he might not want to get wet or ruin his clothes.
So, on rainy days, he prefers taking the elevator all the way up to avoid walking in the rain.
Alternatively, maybe the elevator is faster or more convenient on rainy days.
But I don't think that's the main reason.
It's more likely about the weather conditions making walking less appealing.
So, putting it all together, the man takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor on rainy days because walking up the stairs would be slippery or uncomfortable in the rain.
Therefore, he opts for the elevator to stay dry and comfortable.

</think>

The man takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor on rainy days because walking up the stairs from the 7th floor would be slippery and uncomfortable in the rain.
By taking the elevator, he avoids getting wet and ensures his comfort.
